Agricultural Retail

Tailored setup for agricultural retail businesses engaged in B2B and B2C sales of farming products. Point of Sale (POS) stores & website offer categorised items such as seeds, pesticides, plant nutrition, and farming equipment.

They utilize a suite of modules including Point of Sale, Inventory, Sales, Purchase, Survey, Accounting, Contact and Dashboard. Expanding into the online realm, a website and E-commerce applications can significantly aid their growth in the agricultural retail sector.

‚ÄãBusiness Flows Flow 1: Purchase Flow 2: Sales from Website (B2B / B2C) Flow 3: Sales from POS Flow 4: Opportunity from Website (B2B) and Survey fill

‚ÄãBusiness Flows

Flow 1: Purchase


  • Go to Purchase > Orders > Requests for Quotation
  • Create RFQ for product "Onion Seeds" for vendor "Gloster Organics"
  • Create other RFQ for same product with vendor "Astron Agro"
  • Compare RFQs
  • Confirm RFQ based on best price
  • Validate the reception for all quantities at once.

Flow 2: Sales from Website (B2B / B2C)


If the user is selling their Products from the website.

To do that,

  • Website > configure pricelist
  • Go to Shop Section and Choose Products
  • Process Check Out
  • Add Promocode "AGROFARMA10"
  • Make Payment‚Äã

Flow 3: Sales from POS


For Small Products, customers place orders and make payments at the shop.


  • Create a POS order with required product
  • Add a Promocode "AGROFARMA10"
  • Receive Payment

Flow 4: Opportunity from Website (B2B) and Survey fill


Receive the opportunities through a website.


  • ‚ÄãProspect will go to website and fill the "Contact us" form.
  • Once form is submitted, opportunity will be created in the system.
  • Sales person visit the farmer and fill survey(According to Farmer's Input).
  • Sales person shares quotation and confirm the order.
  • Make Invoice.

Welcome to the ultimate guide on using the Odoo Sales Management app! This tutorial will walk you through all the main features and functionalities of the app, ensuring you can make the most out of your sales processes. However if you need more details or information the documentation can be found here : Odoo Sales Documentation. Let‚Äôs dive in! üåü

üì¶ Module Overview

The Sales Management app in Odoo is designed to streamline your sales operations, manage products effectively, and boost your revenue. Key features include:

  • üîç Quotation and Order Management
  • üìä Sales Analysis and Reporting
  • üì¶ Product and Price Management
  • üìß Email Integration and Automation

üìã Step-by-Step Guide

1Ô∏è‚É£ Setting Up the Sales Management App

To get started, follow these steps to set up the Sales Management app:

  1. Navigate to the Odoo Apps dashboard and search for ‚ÄúSales Management‚Äù.
  2. Click on the ‚ÄúInstall‚Äù button to add the app to your instance.
  3. Once installed, you will see the Sales menu in the top bar. Click on it to access the app.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Creating a Quotation

Quotations are essential for providing potential customers with price estimates. Here‚Äôs how to create one:

  1. Go to the Sales menu and select Quotations.
  2. Click on Create to start a new quotation.
  3. Fill in the customer details by selecting an existing customer or creating a new one.
  4. Add products to the quotation by clicking on Add a product.
  5. Adjust the quantity, price, and discounts as necessary.
  6. Save the quotation by clicking Save(represented by the cloud icon ).
  7. To send the quotation to the customer, click on Send by Email and customize the email content.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Converting Quotations to Sales Orders

Once a customer accepts a quotation, convert it to a sales order to proceed with the sale:

  1. Open the quotation you wish to convert.
  2. Click on Confirm Sale. This will change the status from Quotation to Sales Order.
  3. Manage the delivery and invoicing process from the sales order view.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Managing Sales Orders

Sales orders are the backbone of your sales process. Here‚Äôs how to manage them:

  1. Go to the Sales menu and select Sales Orders.
  2. View the list of all sales orders and filter them based on status, date, customer, etc.
  3. Click on a sales order to view and edit its details, including delivery and invoicing information.

Product and Price Management

Efficiently manage your products and pricing strategies:

  1. Go to the Sales menu and select Products.
  2. View and edit existing products or create new ones by clicking Create.
  3. Define product categories, variants, and attributes to organize your product catalog.
  4. Set up price lists and discount strategies to apply to different customer segments.

üîç Deep Dive into Product Variants, Attributes, and Price Lists

Understanding and setting up product variants, attributes, and price lists are crucial for managing a diverse product range effectively. Here‚Äôs a deeper look into each aspect:

üì¶ Product Variants

Product variants allow you to manage different versions of a product, such as size or color without creating new product for each one.

  1. Navigate to the Sales menu and select Products.
  2. Click on Configuration - Settings > Activate variants
  3. Create a new product or select an existing one.
  4. In the product form, go to the Variants tab.
  5. Click on Add an attribute to define the characteristics that will differentiate your variants, such as size, color, or material.
  6. Add the possible values for each attribute, for example, small, medium, large for size.
  7. Save the product. Odoo will automatically create a variant for each combination of attribute values.

Case Example: If you sell T-shirts in different sizes and colors, you can create attributes for size (small, medium, large) and color (red, blue, green). Odoo will generate variants for each combination, like small-red, medium-blue, etc.

üîñ Product Attributes

Attributes are the characteristics that define different variants of a product.

  1. Go to the Sales menu and select Configuration > Product Attributes.
  2. Click on Create to add a new attribute.
  3. Name the attribute, such as ‚ÄúColor‚Äù or ‚ÄúSize‚Äù.
  4. Add the attribute values, like red, blue, green for color.
  5. Save the attribute. You can now assign it to products to create variants.

üí∞ Price Lists

Price lists allow you to set different prices for products based on customer segments, promotions, or other criteria.

  1. Go to the Sales menu and select Configuration > Settings > Price Lists.
  2. Click on Create to add a new price list.
  3. Define the name and currency for the price list.
  4. Add price rules to determine the prices for different products or product categories. You can set fixed prices, discounts, or formulas based on cost or other factors.
  5. Assign the price list to specific customer segments or apply it globally.

Case Example: You can create a price list with discounted prices for wholesale customers or special promotional prices during a sale period.

6Ô∏è‚É£ Automating Sales Emails

Save time and improve communication by automating sales emails:

  1. Go to the Sales menu and select Configuration > Settings.
  2. Enable the Automated Email feature.
  3. Customize email templates for different stages of the sales process, such as quotation, order confirmation, and invoicing.
  4. Set up triggers for automated emails, ensuring timely communication with customers.

7Ô∏è‚É£ Sales Analysis and Reporting

Analyze your sales data to make informed business decisions:

  1. Go to the Sales menu and select Reporting > Sales Analysis.
  2. Use the various filters and groupings to customize your reports.
  3. Generate insights on sales performance, customer behavior, and product popularity.
  4. Export reports to Excel or PDF for further analysis or sharing with stakeholders.
8Ô∏è‚É£

Introducing Your Sales Team üë•

Assigning employees to a sales team and managing salespersons in Odoo is straightforward:

Assigning Employees to a Sales Team

  1. Go to the Sales menu and select Configuration > Sales Teams.
  2. Click on Create to add a new sales team or select an existing team to edit.
  3. Fill in the team details and add members by selecting employees from the dropdown list.
  4. Save the sales team configuration.

Assigning a Salesperson to a Sale

  1. Open a sales order from the Sales Orders menu.
  2. In the sales order form, find the Salesperson field in the other info tab.
  3. Select the appropriate salesperson from the dropdown list.
  4. Save the sales order.

With these steps, you can effectively organize your sales team and ensure each sale is assigned to the right person, enhancing accountability and performance tracking. üöÄ

üõ†Ô∏è Advanced Features

üîó Integrating with Other Odoo Apps

The Sales Management app seamlessly integrates with other Odoo apps to provide a unified business solution:

  • Inventory: Automatically update stock levels and track product availability.
  • Accounting: Manage invoices and payments directly from sales orders.
  • Marketing: Run email campaigns and track customer engagement.

üìö Beginner's Guide to the Odoo Accounting App

Welcome to the comprehensive tutorial on using the Odoo Accounting app! This guide will help you navigate through the main features and functionalities of the app, ensuring you can efficiently manage your financial processes. If you need more details or information, the documentation can be found here: Odoo Accounting Documentation. Let‚Äôs get started! üåü

üìë Module Overview

The Odoo Accounting app is designed to streamline your financial operations, manage accounts effectively, and provide insightful reporting. Key features include:

  • üìò Chart of Accounts Management
  • üí∏ Invoicing and Payments
  • üìà Financial Reporting and Analysis
  • üìä Cash Management
  • üîÑ Bank Reconciliation
  • üßæ Tax Management

üìã Step-by-Step Guide

1Ô∏è‚É£ Setting Up the Accounting App

To get started, follow these steps to set up the Accounting app:

  1. Navigate to the Odoo Apps dashboard and search for ‚ÄúAccounting‚Äù.
  2. Click on the ‚ÄúInstall‚Äù button to add the app to your instance.
  3. Once installed, you will see the Accounting menu in the top bar. Click on it to access the app.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Configuring the Chart of Accounts

The Chart of Accounts is the backbone of your accounting system. Here‚Äôs how to set it up:

  1. Go to the Accounting menu and select Configuration > Chart of Accounts.
  2. View the default accounts provided by Odoo or import your own.
  3. Create new accounts by clicking on Create, specifying the account type, code, and name.
  4. Organize accounts into hierarchies for better reporting and analysis.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Managing Customers and Vendors

Efficiently manage your customer and vendor information:

  1. Go to the Accounting menu and select Customers or Vendors.
  2. View the list of all customers or vendors details such as invoices, credit notes, bank account, payments, etc. From there, you can also create new ones by clicking on Create.
  3. Enter details such as name, contact information, and payment terms.
  4. Organize customers and vendors into categories for easier management.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Creating and Sending Invoices

Generate professional invoices for your customers:

  1. Go to the Accounting menu and select Customers > Invoices.
  2. Click on Create to start a new invoice.
  3. Select the customer and add invoice lines by choosing products or services.
  4. Set payment terms and due dates.
  5. Save the invoice by clicking Save (represented by the cloud icon )
  6. To send the invoice to the customer, click on Send by Email and customize the email content.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Recording Payments

Keep track of incoming and outgoing payments:

  1. Go to the Accounting menu and select Customers > Payments or Vendors > Payments.
  2. Click on Create to record a new payment.
  3. Select the customer or vendor and enter payment details such as amount, date, and payment method.
  4. Link the payment to the corresponding invoice or bill.
  5. Save the payment by clicking Save (represented by the cloud icon ).
  6. If you want to register a payment for an invoice you already created, go to the invoice and use the smart button 'Register payment' and it will automatically link them.

6Ô∏è‚É£ Managing Bills and Expenses

Effectively manage your bills and track expenses:

  1. Go to the Accounting menu and select Vendors > Bills.
  2. Click on Create to start a new bill.
  3. Select the vendor and add bill lines by choosing products or services.
  4. Enter bill details such as quantity, price, and tax.
  5. Save the bill by clicking Save (represented by the cloud icon ).
  6. To record a payment for the bill, click on Register Payment and enter payment details.

7Ô∏è‚É£ Reconciling Bank Statements

Ensure your financial records match your bank statements:

  1. Go to the Accounting menu and select Bank > Reconciliation.
  2. Import your bank statements or manually enter transactions.
  3. Match bank transactions with corresponding records in Odoo.
  4. Reconcile differences and make adjustments as needed.
  5. Save the reconciliation by clicking Validate.

8Ô∏è‚É£ Tax Management

Manage your taxes efficiently:

  1. Go to the Accounting menu and select Configuration > Taxes.
  2. View the list of existing taxes or click on Create to add new ones.
  3. Define tax rates, types, and applicable accounts.
  4. Apply taxes to products and services for accurate tax calculations.

9Ô∏è‚É£ Cash Management

Effectively manage your cash flow:

  1. Go to the Accounting menu and select Cash Management.
  2. Monitor your cash inflows and outflows to ensure you have enough liquidity to cover your expenses.
  3. Create and manage cash registers to track cash transactions.
  4. Record cash movements, such as cash receipts and cash payments.
  5. Reconcile cash transactions to ensure accuracy.

üîü Payment Reminders (Follow-up levels)

Automate payment reminders to improve cash collection:

  1. Go to the Accounting menu and select Configuration > Followup levels.
  2. Set up reminder rules, such as when reminders should be sent and to whom.
  3. Customize reminder templates to include your company branding and message.
  4. Automate the process of sending reminders based on the due date and payment status.
  5. Track the status of reminders and follow up with customers if necessary.

üîç Example Scenario

Imagine you are managing the finances for a manufacturing company. You need to create invoices for your customers, record payments, manage bills from suppliers, and ensure your cash flow is positive. Here‚Äôs how you would use the Odoo Accounting app:

  • Creating Invoices: Generate invoices for your customers based on sales orders and send them via email.
  • Recording Payments: Record incoming payments from customers and link them to the corresponding invoices.
  • Managing Bills: Enter bills from suppliers, record payments, and track outstanding balances.
  • Cash Management: Monitor your cash flow, ensuring you have enough cash to cover expenses and make strategic financial decisions.
  • Payment Reminders: Set up automated payment reminders to ensure timely collection of outstanding invoices.

üõ†Ô∏è Advanced Features

üîó Integrating with Other Odoo Apps

The Accounting app seamlessly integrates with other Odoo apps to provide a unified business solution:

  • Sales: Automatically generate invoices from sales orders.
  • Inventory: Track stock movements and valuation.
  • HR: Manage employee expenses and payroll.

üìä Analysis and Reporting

Generate insightful financial reports to understand your business performance better:

  1. Go to the Accounting menu and select Reporting.
  2. Choose from various report types such as Balance Sheet, Profit and Loss, Cash Flow Statement, and more.
  3. Customize reports using filters and groupings to focus on specific periods, accounts, or departments.
  4. Analyze your financial data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.
  5. Export reports to Excel or PDF for further analysis or sharing with stakeholders.
  6. Create custom reports to meet specific business requirements, ensuring you have the insights needed to make informed decisions.

üöÄ Beginner Guide to the Odoo CRM App

Welcome to the ultimate guide on using the Odoo CRM app! This tutorial will walk you through all the main features and functionalities of the app, ensuring you can make the most out of your CRM processes. For more details, check the documentation here: Odoo CRM Documentation. Let‚Äôs dive in! üåü

üì¶ Module Overview

The CRM app in Odoo is designed to streamline your customer relationship management, manage leads effectively, and boost your sales. Key features include:

  • üîç Lead and Opportunity Management
  • üìä Sales Pipeline Visualization
  • üìß Email Integration and Automation
  • üìà Reporting and Analysis

üìã Step-by-Step Guide

1Ô∏è‚É£ Setting Up the CRM App

To get started, follow these steps to set up the CRM app:

  1. Navigate to the Odoo Apps dashboard and search for ‚ÄúCRM‚Äù.
  2. Click on the ‚ÄúInstall‚Äù button to add the app to your instance.
  3. Once installed, you will see the CRM menu in the top bar. Click on it to access the app.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Creating and Managing Leads

Leads are potential sales opportunities. Here‚Äôs how to create and manage them:

  • To enable leads go to Configuration > Settings > enable leads

    1. Go to the CRM menu and select Leads.
    2. Click on Create to start a new lead.
    3. Fill in the lead details by entering the customer‚Äôs information and potential deal value. (The predictive score is automatically computed but you can always modify it)
    4. Assign the lead to a salesperson by selecting from the dropdown list. (Sales can be automatically assigned by clicking Configuration > Settings > rule based assignment)
    5. Save the lead by clicking Save.
    6. To manage leads, use the list view to filter and sort based on various criteria like status, salesperson, and date.
    7. Finally you can also set steps in the kanban view to move your leads from steps to steps and set up automations. (by clicking on the gear then automations)

    3Ô∏è‚É£ Converting Leads to Opportunities

    Once a lead is qualified, convert it to an opportunity:

    1. Open the lead you wish to convert.
    2. Click on Convert to Opportunity. This will change the status from Lead to Opportunity.
    3. Assign the opportunity to a sales team if necessary.
    4. Track the progress of the opportunity in the sales kanban view.

    4Ô∏è‚É£ Managing Opportunities

    Opportunities are the core of your sales pipeline. Here‚Äôs how to manage them:

    1. Go to the CRM menu and select Opportunities.
    2. View the list of all opportunities and filter them based on criteria like stage, date, and salesperson.
    3. Click on an opportunity to view and edit its details, including customer information and deal value.
    4. Move opportunities through the sales stages by dragging and dropping them in the kanban view.
    5. You lost an Opportunity? No problems mark it as lost and it will be automatically archived. You can then analyse the lost reason and where the opportunities are lost!

    5Ô∏è‚É£ Converting Opportunities to Sales

    When an opportunity is won, convert it to a sale:

    1. Open the opportunity you wish to convert.
    2. Click on Create Quotation to start the sales process.
    3. Fill in the quotation details and send it to the customer.
    4. Once the customer accepts, confirm the sale to convert the opportunity to a sales order.

    6Ô∏è‚É£ Linking CRM with Your Website

    Integrate your website with the CRM to capture leads directly:

    1. Go to the CRM menu and select Configuration > Settings.
    2. Enable the Visit to Leads feature.
    3. From your website you can also add a contact form, from this by clicking edit, then clicking on the form, in the form you can set up an action : Create opportunities. Congratualtions, now the contact form generate leads for you!

    7Ô∏è‚É£ Automating CRM Emails

    Save time by automating CRM emails:

    1. Go to the CRM menu
    2. Next to each stage you can see a gear. Click on it!
    3. Click on New
    4. Customize your automation by adding an action for different stages of the process, such as send email, send SMS, etc....
    5. From there you can also set up SMS template or Email template for each stage.

    8Ô∏è‚É£ Analyzing CRM Data

    Analyze your CRM data to make informed business decisions:

    1. Go to the CRM menu and select Reporting > CRM Forecast/pipeline.
    2. Use the various filters and groupings to customize your reports.
    3. Generate insights on lead sources, sales performance, and conversion rates.
    4. Export reports to Excel or PDF for further analysis or sharing with stakeholders.

    üõ†Ô∏è Advanced Features

    üîó Integrating with Other Odoo Apps

    The CRM app seamlessly integrates with other Odoo apps to provide a unified business solution:

    • Sales: Convert opportunities directly into sales orders.
    • Marketing: Run email campaigns and track customer engagement.
    • Helpdesk: Manage customer support requests related to leads and opportunities.

    üîß Customizing the CRM

    Tailor the CRM to fit your business needs:

    1. Go to the CRM menu and select Configuration > Settings.
    2. Explore various customization options.
    3. Add custom fields to capture specific information about your leads and opportunities.
    4. Customize the sales stages to reflect your sales process accurately.
    5. Set up workflows to automate repetitive tasks and streamline your CRM processes.

    üë• Managing Teams and Users

    Efficiently manage your sales teams and CRM users:

    1. Go to the CRM menu and select Configuration > Sales Teams.
    2. Create and configure sales teams by adding members and defining roles.
    3. Assign leads and opportunities to specific teams and users to ensure proper follow-up.
    4. Monitor team performance and track individual contributions using the CRM‚Äôs reporting tools.

    With these steps, you can maximize the efficiency of your CRM processes and improve customer relationship management in your business. üöÄ

üì¶ Module Overview

The Stock Management app in Odoo is designed to streamline your inventory operations, manage stock levels, and optimize your warehouse management. Key features include:

  • üîç Inventory Adjustments
  • üìä Warehouse Management
  • üì¶ Product Management
  • üìà Reporting and Analysis
  • üöö Receiving and Delivery Operations
  • üíº Reordering Rules and Automation

üìã Step-by-Step Guide

1Ô∏è‚É£ Setting Up the Stock Management App

To get started, follow these steps to set up the Stock Management app:

  1. Navigate to the Odoo Apps dashboard and search for ‚ÄúInventory‚Äù.
  2. Click on the ‚ÄúInstall‚Äù button to add the app to your instance.
  3. Once installed, you will see the Inventory menu in the top bar. Click on it to access the app.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Managing Stock Levels

Managing stock levels is essential for efficient inventory control. Here‚Äôs how to adjust stock levels:

  1. Go to the Inventory menu and select Inventory Adjustments.
  2. Click on Create to start a new inventory adjustment.
  3. Select the product(s) you wish to adjust and enter the new quantities.
  4. Validate the adjustment to update the stock levels.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Warehouse Management

Efficiently manage your warehouses and stock locations:

  1. Go to the Inventory menu and select Configuration > Warehouses.
  2. Click on Create to add a new warehouse or select an existing one to edit.
  3. Define the warehouse details including name, address, and configuration settings.
  4. Manage stock locations within the warehouse by selecting Locations under the Configuration menu.
  5. Add new locations or edit existing ones to organize your warehouse structure.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Receiving and Delivering Products

Handle receiving and delivery operations efficiently:

Receiving Products

  1. Go to the Inventory menu and select Receipts.
  2. Click on Create to record a new receipt.
  3. Select the supplier and enter the receipt details, including products and quantities.
  4. Validate the receipt to update stock levels.

Delivering Products

  1. Go to the Inventory menu and select Delivery Orders.
  2. Click on Create to record a new delivery order.
  3. Select the customer and enter the delivery details, including products and quantities.
  4. Validate the delivery to update stock levels.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Product Management

Manage your product catalog effectively:

  1. Go to the Inventory menu and select Products.
  2. View and edit existing products or create new ones by clicking Create.
  3. Define product categories, variants, and attributes to organize your product catalog.
  4. Set up stockkeeping units (SKUs) and barcodes for easy identification and tracking.

üîç Deep Dive into Product Variants, Attributes, and Barcodes

Understanding and setting up product variants, attributes, and barcodes are crucial for efficient inventory management. Here‚Äôs a deeper look into each aspect:

üì¶ Product Variants

Product variants allow you to manage different versions of a product, such as size or color, without creating a new product for each one.

  1. Navigate to the Inventory menu and select Products.
  2. Create a new product or select an existing one.
  3. In the product form, go to the Variants tab.
  4. Click on Add an attribute to define the characteristics that will differentiate your variants, such as size, color, or material.
  5. Add the possible values for each attribute, for example, small, medium, large for size.
  6. Save the product. Odoo will automatically create a variant for each combination of attribute values.

üîñ Product Attributes

Attributes are the characteristics that define different variants of a product.

  1. Go to the Inventory menu and select Configuration > Product Attributes.
  2. Click on Create to add a new attribute.
  3. Name the attribute, such as ‚ÄúColor‚Äù or ‚ÄúSize‚Äù.
  4. Add the attribute values, like red, blue, green for color.
  5. Save the attribute. You can now assign it to products to create variants.

üí∞ Barcodes

Barcodes facilitate easy identification and tracking of products:

  1. Go to the Inventory menu and select Products.
  2. Select a product and go to the Inventory tab.
  3. Enter the barcode in the Barcode field.
  4. Save the product. You can now use barcode scanners to manage inventory efficiently.

6Ô∏è‚É£ Reordering Rules and Automation

Set up reordering rules to automate your inventory replenishment:

  1. Go to the Inventory menu and select Products.
  2. Open a product and go to the Inventory tab.
  3. Set the minimum and maximum stock levels to trigger automatic reordering.
  4. Define the supplier for the reordering rule.
  5. Save the product. Odoo will automatically create purchase orders when stock levels fall below the minimum threshold.

7Ô∏è‚É£ Managing Inventory Transfers

Handle inventory transfers between locations and warehouses:

  1. Go to the Inventory menu and select Transfers.
  2. Click on Create to record a new transfer.
  3. Select the source and destination locations, and enter the transfer details including products and quantities.
  4. Validate the transfer to update stock levels at both locations.

8Ô∏è‚É£ Analyzing Inventory Data

Analyze your inventory data to make informed business decisions:

  1. Go to the Inventory menu and select Reporting > Inventory Analysis.
  2. Use the various filters and groupings to customize your reports.
  3. Generate insights on stock levels, product movement, and inventory valuation.
  4. Export reports to Excel or PDF for further analysis or sharing with stakeholders.

9Ô∏è‚É£ Integrating with Other Odoo Apps

The Stock Management app seamlessly integrates with other Odoo apps to provide a unified business solution:

  • Purchase: Automatically update stock levels based on purchase orders and receipts.
  • Sales: Link inventory management with sales orders to ensure product availability.
  • Manufacturing: Manage raw materials and finished products to optimize production processes.
  • Accounting: Track inventory valuation and cost of goods sold for accurate financial reporting.

üîß Customizing the Stock Management App

Tailor the Stock Management app to fit your business needs:

  1. Go to the Inventory menu and select Configuration > Settings.
  2. Explore various customization options like custom fields, workflows, and barcode configurations.
  3. Add custom fields to capture specific information about your stock items and locations.
  4. Set up workflows to automate repetitive tasks and streamline your inventory processes.
  5. Configure barcode settings to match your scanning and labeling requirements.

With these steps, you can maximize the efficiency of your inventory processes and improve stock management in your business. üöÄ

üì¶ Product Variants

Product variants allow you to manage different versions of a product, such as size or color, without creating a new product for each one.

  1. First activate them Configuration > Settings > variants (Do not hesitate to travel the settings view you may find a lot of interesting features!)
  2. Navigate to the Purchase menu and select Products.

  5. Click on Add an attribute to define the characteristics that will differentiate your variants, such as size, color, or material.
  6. Add the possible values for each attribute, for example, small, medium, large for size.
  7. Save the product. Odoo will automatically create a variant for each combination of attribute values.

üîñ Product Attributes

Attributes are the characteristics that define different variants of a product.

  5. Save the attribute. You can now assign it to products to create variants.
